text: is there something in base to take the first `k` elements of a tuple (or less when the tuple has length < k)? basically I want to cap `I::Vararg{Any,L}` to length `k` and then splat it into a function call; it ends up allocating for reasons I don't understand (writing it with a generated function with getindex, or functional style with recursion), I guess it has to do with some type instability when indexing into a tuple.

elements.text: is there something in base to take the first
elements of a tuple (or less when the tuple has length < k)? basically I want to cap

and then splat it into a function call; it ends up allocating for reasons I don't understand (writing it with a generated function with getindex, or functional style with recursion), I guess it has to do with some type instability when indexing into a tuple.

text: it looks pretty, but it's not type stable it seems :disappointed:

elements.text: it looks pretty, but it's not type stable it seems

text: indexing into a tuple shouldn't ever be type unstable, but capping `Vararg{Any,L}` will always incur dynamic dispatch
